alert.note: Alert for Decatur; Grady; Seminole (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 13 at 4:04PM EDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central Jackson, northern Gadsden, southern Decatur, southwestern Grady and south central Seminole Counties through 445 PM EDT/345 PM CDT/... At 403 PM EDT/303 PM CDT/, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Chattahoochee, or 17 miles northwest of Quincy, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Havana, Chattahoochee, Attapulgus, Seminole State Park, Darsey, Mount Pleasant, Concord, Hardin Heights, Rosedale, Jamieson, Recovery, Faceville, Laingkat, Calvary, Jinks, Fowlstown, Amsterdam, Branchville, Hinson and Dogtown. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM EDT/700 PM CDT/ for Big Bend of and the Panhandle of Florida...and southwestern Georgia.
